You have the option to name your thermostats, e.g er location.
• The first time you log in to a thermostat, there will be a number that is automatically assigned by the controller.
 By pressing the number you will be able to change the name.
• You set the temperature by pressing the up/down arrow at an interval of 0.5 degrees.
• You have the option to select one of the preset programmes simply by pressing the desired programme.
 Only when you press "OK" the changes will be registered in the controller.

When you change user ID all connected controllers will be updated at once. If there are multiple users on the same controller, it means that the other users have to change their settings at the next log in otherwise they do not have access to the controllers. If you are no. two user and logs into the app, there will be a warning triangle next to all previously registered controllers. When you press the warning triangle, you will be asked to enter the new user ID and password,er that all controllers with the same user ID and password will be displayed. You can now select which devices you wish to access. Finish with "OK"

The warning triangle indicates that there may be problems with a controller or thermostat.\n• Check if there is contact with all thermostats. Check if the batteries in the thermostat shows the error on the communications (link).\n• Check whether there has been a change of password or user ID of the controller.

For security reasons it is not possible to change a password without having received a reset code. When you ask for a reset code, it will automatically be send to your email. This code must be entered manually. Once when you have received and entered the reset code, you can create a new password. The default password is always 1234. Note: If there are multiple users on the controller, these users have to perform an update on their next login. Press the warning triangle and enter the user ID and new password.

To make your app more user friendly, you must complete e-mail and username. This is mainly used for multiuser installations, but also in case you change phones.\n• Naming the control unit is only to facilitate the overview, especially if you have multiple oor heating systems on your app. However, you cannot use the same name on multiple devices. The naming could e.g. be "At home", "Home", etc.\n• The graphical overview shows the number of control devices that are connected to your app. It is not possible to make changes from this screen.

If you have trouble making contact with your Touchline controller it may be because:\n• Your controller is not set in "Master" mode. Hold the "Master" button on the control device for approximately 10 seconds. See also the manual for Touchline on roth-nordic.com.\n• You are not on the same WLAN as the controller you want to connect to.
